paper_abstract: In this paper we present LSJ, a contraction-free sequent calculus for Intuitionistic propositional logic whose proofs are linearly bounded in the length of the formula to be proved and satisfy the subformula property. We also introduce a sequent calculus RJ for intuitionistic unprovability with the same properties of LSJ. We show that from a refutation of RJ of a sequent sigma we can extract a Kripke counter-model for sigma. Finally, we provide a procedure that given a sequent sigma returns either a proof of sigma in LSJ or a refutation in RJ such that the extracted counter-model is of minimal depth.
paper_title: Contraction-Free Linear Depth Sequent Calculi for Intuitionistic Propositional Logic with the Subformula Property and Minimal Depth Counter-Models
